items.title: Live: Bushfire disaster declared in Victoria as heatwave intensifies across NSW
items.description: Three emergency-level bushfires continue to rage across Victoria after a state of disaster was declared by Victorian Premier Jacinta Allen. Follow live.

items.title: Weekend brings fire threat to NSW with maximums to hit 44C
items.description: The heatwave, which has engulfed southern Australia this week, has become one of the most intense on record.

items.title: North Queensland braces for tropical cyclone likely to form today
items.description: North Queensland residents are readying themselves as a tropical low is likely to become a category one cyclone later today.

items.title: The rhetoric of the Trump administration has taken a chilling turn
items.description: There have been plenty of examples of the Trump administration's contempt for legalities, diplomacy and alliances but this week Trump and his lieutenants went further.

items.title: Mums who drank during pregnancy call for universal alcohol warnings
items.description: New research shows thousands of alcohol products remain on Australian shelves without mandated pregnancy warning labels.

items.title: Iran's leader accuses protesters of trying to 'please' Trump
items.description: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has remained defiant amid nationwide protests, saying his regime would not back down in the "face of saboteurs."

items.title: 'Rich have become poor': Venezuelans describe their daily struggle
items.description: The ABC hears from residents of Venezuela's capital, Caracas, about the struggles of daily life and their hopes and fears after American intervention.

items.title: Elon Musk limits X's AI image generator over non-consensual sexual imagery
items.description: For more than a week, X's AI bot Grok has been generating sexual images of women and children at the request of other users, even when they ask it not to.

items.title: The Bondi royal commission is due to report in April. Here's what we know
items.description: After growing calls for a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack, the prime minister has finally announced it would take place, saying it "was what Australia needs".

items.title: Greta Beach should be pristine. Instead, it's choking on a tsunami of plastic waste
items.description: A beach on a remote island, and home to nesting turtles, is annually overwhelmed by tonnes of plastic garbage. Christmas Island is doing what it can to help stem the never-ending tide of pollution.

items.title: A Tasmanian council built a wall. It hasn't gone down well
items.description: A concrete wall built on the picturesque waterfront of a small Tasmanian town has prompted confusion and concern from residents.

items.title: From PFAS to perfection: The story behind regional NT town's 'designer' water
items.description: The tap water in the Northern Territory town of Katherine — which includes a "designer" mix of river water from the world-famous Nitmiluk National Park and mineral-rich groundwater — has been named Australia's best drop.

items.title: Barmy Army turns Ashes defeat into Australian tourism win
items.description: The Barmy Army has continued the recent trend of UK travellers spending more time and money in Australia, despite a disappointing on-field performance from their side.

items.title: NSW SES to allow people to volunteer for a day when disaster strikes
items.description: Experts say volunteering is not in decline, but it is becoming more spontaneous. The NSW disaster agency is moving to embrace this after seven women mobilised 1,200 people to volunteer for a day in record-breaking floods.

items.title: 'Terrible job to cuddle baby wombats': Behind the scenes as a wildlife carer
items.description: There are about 40-50 active volunteer carers within ACT Wildlife, but the organisation says more are needed, especially as the temperature soars.

items.title: Philippines landfill collapse kills at least one person with dozens missing
items.description: Rescuers managed to recover 13 people from the site overnight as efforts continue to try and find others trapped under the mountain of rubbish.

items.title: Hopes Beijing may lift soft ban on South Korea pop culture as ties thaw
items.description: China has restricted access to South Korean pop culture since 2016, when Seoul received US anti-missile technology. Warmer bilateral ties are spurring optimism that will change.

items.title: How the Sopranos transformed TV as we know it
items.description: Restaurant owners in New York would eventually complain of "the Soprano effect" when they lost trade on Sunday nights as patrons headed home to watch the show.

items.title: Aussies exit United Cup and Poland advances to semis
items.description: Alex de Minaur produces a signature tenacious display, but it is not enough to send Australia through to the United Cup semifinals in Sydney.

items.title: Sabalenka defeats Keys in Australian Open final re-match
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka says she is no longer thinking about last year's Australian Open final loss to Madison Keys after defeating the US star at the Brisbane International.

items.title: English is Toki's second language, but he sings in a classic Elvis drawl
items.description: Japanese tribute artist Toki Toyokazu is part of a growing international presence at the annual Parkes Elvis Festival, which also includes women.

items.title: Donald Trump withdraws the US from 66 international organisations
items.description: Protecting women and children, halting climate change and preventing acts of terrorism — these are the goals the White House now says go against America's goals.

items.title: US border agent shoots and wounds two people in Portland, Oregon, police say
items.description: US Border Patrol agents were conducting a vehicle stop in Portland when the driver "weaponised" the vehicle before an officer "fired a defensive shot", according to the Department of Homeland Security.

items.title: In Greenland, Trump's talk of annexation is stirring up a dark past
items.description: The United States has a long history of wanting to acquire Greenland, but people living on the island say Donald Trump's latest comments about annexation feel different.

items.title: Russia hits Ukraine with hypersonic missile, Qatari embassy damaged
items.description: A "massive" Russian night-time attack on Ukraine damaged 20 residential buildings in Kyiv and its suburbs, as well as Qatar's embassy, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says.
